intro: Bufonia calycina, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from purple to pink, often blooming in the early morning. It is an annual herb that thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural areas. Bufonia calycina is also known for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional medicine.
